{3: '—Two kilometers away from the conservation area 001 rebuild.'}
{3: 'A hole punctures the clouds at the edge of the dull, gray sky, allowing the soft glow of the sun to go through and cast a light on a towering building.'}
{1: '1', 3: "The wind blows past the buildings, gently bashing against the lady's clothes."}
{3: 'She stands in the gap of a broken railing at the edge of a balcony, where the birds of the city claim their domains.'}
{3: 'Underneath an eye-catching, old-fashioned floppy hat is a pair of golden pupils staring into the distance.'}
{3: 'In theory, she can stand there until the reinforcing bars decay and break as long as the parts that maintain her balance remain functional.'}
{3: 'The slender figure built with an amalgamation of metal alloys is more powerful than the strongest body made with flesh and blood.'}
{3: 'But why is she standing there?'}
{3: 'However you view it, she still looks like a pigeon that is alone and helpless, lost in an intense debate of whether to fall.'}
{3: 'Leaving her be does not seem like a good idea, but recalling your last encounter, you figure you should be more cautious in case she thinks you are hostile again.'}
{3: 'You open your arms and position them visibly before you, approaching the lady carefully.'}
{3: 'Then she sees you, her eyes clear as a peaceful pond like before.'}
{2: 'Haicma', 3: '"Get some fresh air on the balcony and take in the scenery." I was simply following the instruction.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Haicma', 3: "Since some of the buildings are blocking the view, I've calculated that this is the best location to do so.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Haicma', 3: 'Do you have any suggestions?', 4: '1'}
{3: 'You think back. You are here on this balcony because you noticed the strayed Construct after you dodged a falling object.'}
{3: 'And you almost became the first recorded commandant to be heavily wounded by a fallen railing.'}
{2: '(Express all your queries)', 3: '28'}
{2: 'Haicma', 3: "...I was sent here to scout the area. Currently, I'm on my maintenance break.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Haicma', 3: 'About the metal railing—', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Haicma', 3: 'It was occupying the best location to "get some fresh air on the balcony" according to my calculations, so I proceeded to remove it.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'She says it casually as if all she has done was putting a book away as she holds down her hair gently to keep the wind from blowing it back.'}
{2: "There's something I want to know personally...", 3: '33'}
{2: 'Why not a hilltop if you just want some fresh air?', 3: '34'}
{2: 'Haicma', 3: 'According to the diaries, getting fresh air on the balcony can relieve stress.', 4: '1'}
{2: "So the balcony is also a factor... And you're stressed?", 3: '36'}
{2: 'Haicma', 3: 'Stressed about the diaries.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'She holds up a bundle of neatly strapped notebooks.'}
{2: 'Haicma', 3: 'This is the most I can collect in a day, and, presumably, they are still not enough.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'What do you mean?', 3: '40'}
{2: 'Haicma', 3: 'Instead of these incomplete journals, I require more comprehensive records.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'More comprehensive?'}
{2: 'Haicma', 3: 'A diary should contain everything its author does in one solar day.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Your spider-sense is tingling.'}
{2: 'Haicma', 3: 'For example... records on activities, records on thoughts, records on visuals, records on audio, records on smell...', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Haicma', 3: 'Records on touch, records on simulated emotions, records on frame status...', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Haicma', 3: 'Records on combat, records on weapon maintenance, records on injuries...', 4: '1'}
{3: 'The girl before you is speaking non-stop at incredible speed. It is even wilder than that guy from Babylonia who fudges his report summary.'}
{3: '"Isn\'t it great that we don\'t have to breathe? How sick it is to say everything in one go?—A certain Construct"'}
{3: 'But if you do not stop her right here, her M.I.N.D. will deviate.'}
{2: 'Haicma', 3: 'Was there something wrong with the sequence? Or did I forget something?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'You only need to journal the important things.', 3: '56'}
{2: 'Haicma', 3: 'Important things?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Haicma', 3: 'I believe the data sets I mentioned are highly prioritized.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'And above them?', 3: '59'}
{2: 'Haicma', 3: '...Please clarify. What is more important than data about yourself?', 4: '1'}
{2: "Let's say there's something before you.", 3: '61'}
{2: 'Something that can make you forget your data for a while.', 3: '62'}
{2: "That's what you put down in a diary.", 3: '63'}
{2: "Look. You don't see health data in that diary, right?", 3: '66'}
{2: 'Haicma', 3: '"October 21st. Took some meds today for my upset stomach..."', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Haicma', 3: 'Error report and maintenance report.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'But were you drawn to that or the other content?', 3: '70'}
{3: 'She falls silent.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'It seems that she can still understand, albeit in a less straightforward way. If words are the problem...'}
{2: 'What about painting?', 3: '74'}
{2: 'Haicma', 3: 'Painting?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Pictures are more direct than words.', 3: '77'}
{2: "Paint one picture every day about the most important thing you've seen that day.", 3: '78'}
{2: 'Haicma', 3: 'Just one?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Haicma', 3: 'I see. To eliminate the chance that I record everything onto my paintings...', 4: '1'}

{2: 'Haicma', 3: 'The viability of this experiment is estimated to be high. Despite having recorded all visual data in my internal memory drive, I believe this external recording is the closest approximation to being human.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'A 24-hour footage record? You cannot believe they have installed this function for the Constructs in conservation areas...'}
{3: 'Still, she is not very guarded for a Construct that acts alone.'}
{2: "Aren't you worried that I might be tricking you?", 3: '85'}
{2: 'Haicma', 3: 'Given that your heart rate has not fluctuated, the possibility of you lying to me is low.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Haicma', 3: "And your suggestion is indeed viable. It doesn't matter if it was a lie.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'You should still be more careful.', 3: '88'}
{2: 'Haicma', 3: "That's not necessary. From the data I've collected, you pose no threat.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'Looking her in the eyes, you immediately remember the day you met and how quickly she subdued you.'}
{3: 'Maybe it is the light, but you seem to notice a slight change in her tranquil expression.'}
{2: 'Haicma', 3: 'Smiling... Are you recommending I smile right now?', 4: '1'}
{3: '...Never mind. Now is not the time to dwell on it.'}
{3: 'You should return to your mission, now that you have confirmed her safety.'}
{3: 'After all, the airdrops have begun. The conservation area nearby needs you to bring back enough supplies.'}
{2: 'Haicma', 3: 'Are you leaving?', 4: '1'}
{2: "Yeah. Let's save it for next time if there's something else.", 3: '103'}
{2: 'Haicma', 3: 'Next time? The chances of us meeting again have decreased from 1.4% to 0.12%. This possibility is negligible.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Haicma', 3: "If there's something else you want to say, I recommend you say it now.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'Why does her description unnerve you...?'}
{2: 'Can you tell me your name?', 3: '107'}
{2: 'Haicma', 3: 'Haicma.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Haicma... You repeat the name, and you are pretty sure it is not on any deployment list you have seen.'}
{3: 'You figure the higher-ups must have been pushing for more Constructs so that they can save the starving conservation areas from despair.'}
{2: "You don't believe in miracles, do you, Haicma?", 3: '111'}
{2: 'Haicma', 3: 'Miracles? The occurrences of impossible odds?', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Perhaps it is just a spur of the moment, or perhaps you have been affected by the dropping estimated success rate in the rescue report, but you do not want her to draw that conclusion.'}
{2: 'If we keep trying, maybe our efforts will turn into a miracle.', 3: '114'}
{2: 'Haicma', 3: 'That is just your one-sided perspective. Miracles are merely after-the-fact conclusions.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'But miracles exist. The conservation area is one of them, and so is this encounter.', 3: '116'}
{2: 'Haicma', 3: 'A correction: we had a 1.4% chance of encountering each other this time. That is a higher possibility than what humans have traditionally considered a miracle.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'So, if we meet again after this...', 3: '118'}
{2: 'Will you believe in miracles, then?', 3: '119'}
{2: 'Haicma', 3: 'Why do you keep pushing me to believe in miracles?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Because sending you to this conservation area...', 3: '121'}
{2: '...Is to create miracles in the first place.', 3: '122'}
{3: "Haicma gazes at the human's departing figure."}
{3: '"If you knew that my purpose was not what you expected, you would have understood why your statement was false from the very start."'}
{3: 'Her processor has long arrived at this conclusion, but Haicma cannot communicate this message no matter what.'}
{3: 'She might have agreed with the human if she were a Construct. They may be machines physically, but they still share the same souls as humans.'}
{3: 'Which is why Constructs are not accepted into the Church of Machina.'}
{2: 'Haicma', 3: 'Machines do not make mistakes. It has always been like that.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'She does not worry about being heard. The human has long vanished at the end of the corridor after waving goodbye.'}
{3: 'She watches that corner until a passing breeze rattles the paper.'}
{3: 'She should also go now...'}
{2: 'Haicma', 3: 'I must prepare for my paintings.', 4: '1'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory60.jpg'}
{1: '1', 3: 'When the night has come, and the land is quiet, Haicma, having returned to her base, takes out a piece of paper and places it on a drawing board.'}
{3: 'Slowly, the empty world is filled with colors and lines.'}
{3: 'In the center of it is the departing figure of a human, walking farther and father away.'}
{3: "This is Haicma's first painting in many years."}
